comment: She was not a bad professor. She moves very fast and was hard to understand when she wore a mask. Lots of homework and PreCalculus is super hard period. She helps out though, and she is nice and caring. She does quizzes so make sure to go to every class.

She is good to take if youre fine with fast paced lectures. As long as you do a little bit outside of class you should be fine. The first two exams were average and the last one was hard, but there are so many opportunities to replace grades that you shouldnt worry about passing. She is nice but passive aggressive. The homework load was average.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Hartmangruber is a fantastic math professor.  She is very knowledgeable and gives good explanations.  She grades fairly and gives a lot of partial credit, which is particularly important for Calc II.  One of the best professors I've had.  Just be ready to work, because that's just what you have to do to do well in calculus.

I took AP Calc in high school and struggled to grasp the information. She goes over lots of examples and explains everything very well. Attend class otherwise, it is very hard to keep up. If you have near-perfect attendance bonus points are added to your final grade. I ended up with around a 96 in this class! I definitely recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: If you have the option to take her class, do it! I hadn't taken any math in over 13 years and if not for her I wouldn't of passed. She's extremely accessible both inside and outside of class and is more than willing to help you with any problems as long as it's a reasonable time. She gives partial credit and it'll save your grade, she's the best!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a fantastic teacher. I've been out of school for about 14 years and just recently returned and it was a lot of work to catch up and get a good understanding of how everything worked again. She's extremely accessible and very willing to help you understand whatever you're struggling with, inside and outside of class. She's the GOAT!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a great teacher and her tests for the most part are sort of similar to the notes and study guides she provides. However, make sure you really understand the concepts so when there are any tricky questions on the tests you will be able to handle them. (2pts extra for attendance - can only miss up to 2 classes)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: she is a good teacher but talks the entire class nonstop very fast. you have to be able to keep up with her. she gives partial credit as long as you show your work, but also says attendance is not mandatory then proceeds to randomly give in class activities that are worth quiz grades. basically if you take her, attend every class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Great teacher, always kind. She was a good teacher teaching difficult material. This was my 2nd time taking this class and she explained it in a different way than my other professor which made me learn it better. Please come to class and do all the HWs on ALEKS.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Online Savvy

comment:
She is a wonderful teacher. She will answer questions like that, 
STUDY THE CLASS NOTES &
ATTEND THE OFFICE HOURS & you'd able to catch up, bc she goes FAST. 
but you will learn a lot from her, because she is very knowledgeable, I would take her again and again and again. to learn what my current professor doesn't teach me,
She's that freaking good
rating_tags: Tough grader--Respected--Lecture heavy

comment: Doesn’t teach well at all and bases her teaching off of questions people ask. In order to learn you literally have to ask her to break it down but she’s not even good at that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This class wasnt bad at all and she worked through every problem step by step, even basic algebra. There were a bunch of in-class assignments + 3 tests and the final. Super easy to be honest. Her notes/assignments follow closely to her tests. Also a lot of Aleks homework but every class has that! She doesnt grade hard & gives partial credit
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Worst math teacher I have ever had. I literally took AP Calc in highschool and received a 96 the semester before and still managed to do poorly in her class. She was horrible and makes the tests so incredibly difficult and worded poorly. She also made a huge deal about not coming to class if you felt sick, yet required a doc note every time u miss.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: I love Ms. Hart. Listen to this review if you're planning on taking her, this is all you'll ever need. Her lectures are very fast paced, she is very understanding if you ask questions. My advice, pratice problems outside of class. Final replaces lowest exam, but for me it was all the lowest. You have to put in the work this aint no pleasure cruise.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Please I am begging you to read all the bad reviews, they are all spot on! She is easily the worst professor I have ever had. It feels like the test are designed to make you fail. I am normally an A student when it comes to math but I have been struggling to even make C's on my tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Please dont listen to the good reviews on here she is so bad at teaching calc omg. She goes way too fast doing problems and constantly skips steps assuming you already know what to do leaving me and many others constantly confused in her class. I am basically teaching myself through the $108 hw program that is mandatory for the class! Evil!!!!!!!!

She was great! It was a hard class for me, I had not taken a math class in a very long time. She was always available to help and answer questions. I loved how she validated students who asked a question in class and would follow up with them to make sure they understood. There is a lot of work in ALEKS but if you do it it will help you learn lots!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Hartmangruber is an excellent professor. I had her for college algebra on an course. She reteaches you everything you learned in high school, and is very helpful and caring. The class consisted of hw on ALEKS every week, 4 tests, and quizzes. She can be a little strict with some things, but overall a great prof.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Perhaps the best Math professor at this school. If you're the type of person who has to take Calc II but is generally bad at math, she is perhaps you're only chance at passing. This is because she reviews basic algebra concepts every time she uses them and tells you how to do each problem step-by-step. She'll be your saving grace.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: BEST CALC 2 PROF EVER, her lectures are long and heavy but she does multiple examples and is super nice about asking questions, and never makes you feel dumb. Her tests are similar to the quizzes and the practice problems she puts up. The final is just like her tests and she does everything she can to prepare you. If you suck at math take her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: I withdrew from her class because she taught it very poorly everyone in my class was struggling the whole time and many withdrew as well, i would not recommend taking her class. out of 10 i would give her a solid 1
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Honesty one of the worst math teachers I have had. I basically taught myself through Aleks, because the way she explained it made everything 10 times harder. Theres a lot of home work, so be aware of that before you sign up for her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: DONT TAKE THIS WOMAN!!!!! if you want to fail then this professor is perfect for you! she told my entire class we will all fail and guess what half of my class failed. you get 20+ topics a week to teach yourself online, her tests are 7 questions and you have 100+ topics to study for per test! would rather eat rocks than take her class again!!!!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! Save yourself from this monster!! More than half of my class failed or withdrew. During tests she will take off 5+ points per problem if you don't show all of your work even if you got the correct answer. She makes you write down the mental math and by that I mean writing out 1+12, biggest pain in the a$$
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Hartmangruber is the BEST math teacher I've ever had. She explains concepts very clearly, and never gets flustered no matter how many times you ask her to explain something. Her lectures are pretty hard to sit through though, since they're long and she goes SUPER fast. Not too much homework and exams are straightforward!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: AVOID AT ALL COST LIKE YOUR LIFE DEPENDS ON IT! DO NOT TAKE! SHE IS REALLY TOUGH ON GRADING AND REALLY STRICT ON JUST MINOR ISSUES LIKE EQUAL SIGNS AND ARROWS AND IF YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND HER METHOD OF TEACHING AND USE OTHER WAYS MAJOR POINTS WILL BE TAKEN OFF OF YOUR EXAMS!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Participation matters

comment: Her lectures are dull, long, and she likes to overcomplicate things. Tough grader, if you don't get your equal signs/arrow signs right, thats points down the drain. rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dont take this teacher. Worst professor I have ever had and at KSU. Blames the whole class for failing when she didnt teach it right. Test are so dumb and literally designed for you to fail. AVOID AT ALL COST.

comment: Professor Hartmangruber sounds like she's a great calc teacher but I can not stress enough how terrible she is at teaching algebra. Especially online. comment: Shes a good teacher but she has to fill up the class time so she goes way too far in depth with lectures. Aleks (what we do homework on) will help you so much but if you dont have algebra knowledge already, it will be difficult. Shes a sweetheart and wants to help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Cool person but not a very cool algebra teacher, at least when the class is online. Easily my least favorite class of the semester due to lack of helpful resources and general uninterest.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Took for algebra online and it just a whole mess. lectures are on d2l on her small whiteboard and then we have a ton of ALEKs homework. honestly she should just give us the aleks stuff and aleks test and leave us alone. lectures are all over the place and teach random things sometimes. if theres someone better, go with them
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you told me this woman was good at teaching calculus and everything but algebra, I would believe you. She teaches a lot that isnt necessarily needed. She doesnt post enough resources to help study. VERY HARD TO GET A HOLD OF considering the amount of emails she sends out. I hate math.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Do not take her. Shes giving us math quizzes and we cant use a calculator or scratch paper. It is ridiculous and if this continues to happen I will fail her class.

comment: Do not take her for Algebra. She is a good calc professor but not algebra she makes things too hard to understand and teachers us more than we need to know for test.

comment: No. just no. Maybe for calc but not online algebra 2. Teaches u more than what u need to know. So hard to follow online and lectures dont make sense. Never post anything to help you. comment: I took her during Fall 2019, I would have to said that she is an excellent choice. Her test is solid, the way she teaches is clear and effective. comment: Ms.H is a professor that wants to see you succeed and gives the maximum help to actually understand the topics. Although she is a tough grader on tests, she gives tons of feedback on homework and explains the solutions thoroughly. I would highly recommend.

comment: Dr. Hartmangruber is one of the best professors I've taken. She's very good at explaining concepts. She gives many quizzes with unlimited retake opportunities. comment: Emily is an amazing professor who gives so many examples of each topic that you won't be caught off guard for the test. comment: She cares a lot about her students. She is always willing to help and teaches concepts very thoroughly. However, she is a tough grader; you have to be very specific in your work. rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: All you have to do is show up and act like a real student and you will pass with flying colors. She is amazing at teaching, and you can even text her questions about homework. TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Hartmangruber is an excellent choice when taking Calculus 2. She gives a ton of examples and works them out (2-3 Pages worth) for the class. She doesnt hesitate to answer or clarify questions. Her HW are sheets you print online. Her tests arent hard but it doesnt mean its a given A. Work hard and youll pass, she also has an SI assistant.

comment: Best teacher I've ever had. I would gladly take her for any math class. Calc 2 is said to be the toughest stem class but she teaches it well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ms. H is a great professor, very willing to help and reply to question quickly. Take her for Calculus 2 and you will guarantee an A. rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I take her college algebra class and she is a great teacher. She teaches pretty fast and won't return to the material from the previous day so make sure you pay attention and take notes. No study guide but goes over review the class before the test that is helpful. Also allows re-do on all quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She's probably the best math teacher I've ever had. She explained everything in detail and had good examples as well as tips on how to remember certain things.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She really wants you to succeed. Every kind of problem she will ever ask you about is similar to one she has taught you. Her homework is straightforward and on paper. She grades very in-depth, so you will know exactly where you went wrong. Unless you make a middle-school algebra mistake, she is very forgiving with partial credit. Best professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Calc 2 is hard, but this woman made it so simple. She's incredibly patient and accessible. She's kind of a tough grader, but she never gives you problems she hasn't taught. This was my easiest class this semester. The class average on the tests were usually 80-90. She's an angel.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This has got to be the best Calc 2 prof at KSU. She does not use online HW, and the HW she gives is the same type of problems you get on the test. Go to class, she spends most of the time doing examples. Take good notes, do HW, and study; youll leave with an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: TAKE HER CLASS. She's wonderful and everyone I've talked to says she's the best. Her lectures are dry but to the point. She tells you exactly what you need to study for her tests. She gives you a week for hw and quizzes. She puts practice quizzes online and they help a lot. You'll leave her class almost over-prepared for Calc 3.

comment: Great professor. She does several practice problems in class to prepare you for the exam. Calc 2 is difficult but go to office hours,SMART center, and SI .

comment: She is the best Calc 2 professor there is at KSU. you have to work for your grade but it is far more possible than some of the other professors. Do anything you can to get a seat in her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: For anyone that is taking Calculus 2 please God take her. She is the easiest and best math teacher Ive ever had. She is super nice and loves to help. rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ms. H is HANDS DOWN the best math professor at KSU. If you don't go to class, be prepared to fail. She can fly through lectures, but she was easy to follow and keep up with. I would take her again in a heartbeat. Her homework is NOT ONLINE (god bless no MathLab) and quizzes prepare you for her exams. TAKE HER!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Lecture heavy, yes, just like any other course. This professor is the bast professor I have ever had. She grades super easy, and prepares you for every test and quiz. The practice tests and quizzes looks exactly like actual thing. You can re take any Quiz at any time and there is no online homework. she gives easy examples and formula sheets.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hands down the best math professor at KSU. I am a math tutor and I have never heard one student say one bad thing about her. I took her class and really enjoyed it. TONS of examples. No crazy test questions. It is calculus 2 however so keep that in mind. If you HAVE to take calculus 2 DEFINITLY take it with her. Would be friends with her.
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Great teacher
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Hartmangruber is fantastic! She is very clear with what you need to know for each test and the material is covered well in each lecture. Attendance is not mandatory but it is best to show up because the lectures are really in depth and informative. You can also get bonus points if your attendance is great at the end of the semester. 10/10
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Prof H is a good choice for taking pre calc. She is very straight forward on her tests (they pretty much match the questions she goes over in class). She does lecture fast and its easy to get lost but shes always asking the class if they have questions. Going to class will be your best friend because she offers extra points for attendance.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A great professor. Obviously calc 2 isn't going to be easy , but if you pay attention and put in the required work, an A is attainable. She's very accessible and a great professor overall.

If given the chance, please take Mrs. H. She has a very good understanding of the content and makes it easy understand the lessons. Although she moves quickly, which is only because she has to, she is more than willing to clear up any confusion mid-lesson, and if not then, then during her office hours. This professor will work with you if you will.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Very good lecturer, but moves very fast. Questions are your best friend, if you don't understand what she is saying, ask her. Calc2 is very difficult, but I found her to be refreshingly straighforward about it. If you keep up with homework and attend every class, the class is difficult, but doable. Skipping class regularly is a terrible idea.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Her lectures are very dense, but she is very intelligent and knows what she's doing. I'd recommend attending as many classes as possible. Her feedback on homework, quizzes, and test should tell you where to improve.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Way too fast. I am not a math wiz and calc 2 is pretty tough. When she teaches it feels like she's just showing off her math skills, she blasts through examples and then acts surprised when the class has questions and can't keep up. Her lisp and attitude combine for an experience that feels degrading not engaging.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Absolutely take Mrs. H. She is the math teacher I have had in my college career. I understand simple math better than I ever have after this class. If you out any effort forth in the class, you should get an A or B.  She is also super nice in office hours. Write down everything she says though. Tests are not as bad as she says they are, just study.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor H is a quality professor that knows what she's talking about. With that being said, she lectures extremely fast and if you can't keep up YOU WILL get lost but, she is readily available to answer all of your questions plus offers ample amount of opportunities  to boost your grade. If you're willing to put in the work you will do fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof Harmangruber is the bees knees. DO NOT miss her lectures. You will regret it for the rest of the semester. If you have questions, ask. She will stop class to make sure you understand. If you do poorly on a quiz, she will lets you retake it.  If you want to understand Calc 2 and take something away from the class, this is the prof for you 100%
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Best professor I ever had. I had her for calc 1  and calc 2. Made A in both classes. Most caring professor one can ever have! never touched the textbook.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Very solid math teacher. Goes over lots of examples in class. She goes really fast but if you can keep up you'll do fine. Lots of tutoring opportunities and she is very sharp in general.

She is a great teacher. Explains everything very clearly. She has a tendency to go too quickly through notes. However, if you tell her to slow down, she will. All she wants to do is help. Really cares about her students. However, you will never get out early. She uses up all of the time that she is given. Most importantly go to class!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very nice woman; and will not hesitate to work with you. However; I found it very difficult to follow along in her class without any sort of plan for the semester. This is the first time I've never had a syllabus to follow; I was lost the entire semester. I never knew what chapter we were on. Why NOT have a plan for the semester; I don't understand
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Calculus is hard, but her tests are even harder than the homework.  I had to drop even though I had a tutor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I did not take Calculus in high school but got an A.  She went sort of fast but I went to class and studied and did well.  I would recommend her.  She is very helpful and has review sessions to help prepare you for tests.

If you took calc in high school and remember most of it, easy A with minimal effort. If this is ur 1st time in calc, it'll take some time to grasp material since she tends to go fast. But if you're a good student, you'll make an A. Not the best calc professor, but one of the easiest. Oh,& she adds  2 points to ur grade for "exemplary" attendance!!

Really awesome professor for Calc 2! Explained all concepts clearly with lots of examples, and if anyone asked a question over something from the lecture, she would go out of her way to find new ways to explain the concept to the student. 3 exams were spaced throughout the semester, followed by a final exam. Also gives credit for regular attendance

I took her for Applied Calc and I really didn't like her. She is confusing with her examples and her methods make the problems harder than they should be.  This also is just personal but I found her personality to be really annoying, it's hard to describe but you just have to be around her and you'll see what I mean.

The reason she does not get a 5 on easiness is because I took her for calculus 2, and that is not her job to make that class easy. She is probably the best math teacher I have had in a long time. She doesn't waste your time (comes to class, does examples, explains) and in general gives rocks. Overall. Respect and gratitude for her teaching.

3 tests, 5 quizzes, 5 homework assignments for whole semester. For lecture, she talks the whole time without stopping, which makes it easy to zone out. Struggles with explaining simple concepts. However,VERY clear grading criteria,tests are simple & straightforward, & she adds 2 points to overall grade for "exemplary" attendance at end of semester.

She is very nice and definitely willing to help and very encouraging to students. She does fly through the material though, I could barely keep up with note taking and probably would have had a pretty hard time if I had not taken precalculus in high school.

Short tests, but they're easy if you actually go to class, do the homework, and STUDY! Her notes are clear and the tests and quizzes are almost identical to the notes we go over in class or practices she posts online.

The problem I had with her was that she wrote down plenty of examples but never explained them. This made it very tough to keep up especially since she speeds through. Doesn't care about being your friend and is very monotone. Stumbles upon her speech and examples which confuses everyone. No one in the class would say a word

Take lots of notes, but don't write down everything that she does either because she'll go off a tangents a lot.  Homework (6 questions with 1-3 parts per question) is due almost every week and tests are pretty easy if you do the HW and study for the exam. GO TO CLASS, though, because she flies through material and takes attendance as a grade.
If you rate her low then you don't come to class and don't do your homework.  Simply act like a college student and you will get an A or B.
If you have to take the second calculus class she is definantley the one to take.  Clear cut on her expectations and tests
She is a gggreat calculus teacher and highly recommend her for your calculus sequence at Kennesaw.
she a phoenomenal teachern and very kind.  Lots of extra credit so take her!
SHe gives extra credit that can bring you up a letter grade.  TAke her fur sure!

She was one of the most helpful math teachers i have ever had. She was always more than willing to meet with me if i ever didn't understand a topic. IF you do the homework, and study for a good bit, you will get an A. Highly recommend her!

Lectures are super long. she starts teaching without even saying hello. She  gives alot of leeway on her tests though and genuinely wants you to do well. She drops 2 HW grades and your final replaces your lowest test score. She moves super fast but will help you if you go to her office hours.
Extremely hard, speeds through material. If you're not good at math don't take her. But she does give you the option if you're failing to make a B on the final and she'll pass you.
This class reminds me of a high school class. Tests are super easy. I got an A+ on every single one.

Does't stop teaching from when class starts until it ends. Retaught myself everything later at home. She gives a ton of examples but speeds through explaining the process. Will reply to emails but sometimes takes a few hours or days. 3 tests, 3 quizzes and a final. Not the best but not the worst. Just be prepared to spend hours studyingpracticing
Hard class, but she is always available to help.
Offers extra credit for "exemplary attendance." Not too worried about being your friend, but she does care about how you do in the class. Tests aren't too hard.

She literally will start class without even saying 'Hello'. She pulls out her notes that she probably prepared over the summer and just re-writes them on the board, leaving little time for anyone to ask questions (so nobody does). The class is just copying exactly what she writes and praying you'll understand it when you review it at home later.
Mrs. Hartmagruber is a great professor. I highly recommend her!

Must attend class. She has an attendance sheet that she passes around so students can sign. She's very helpful and willing to answer any question. Do your homework and review it beforehand. Take lots of notes and review them because her exams are based on them. Overall, it is an easy A if you enjoy math.
